name: py-biom-format

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
The BIOM file format (canonically pronounced biome) is designed to be a
general-use format for representing biological sample by observation
contingency tables.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-click
dependencies.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-future
dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pyqi
dependencies.description:
pyqi (canonically pronounced pie chee) is a Python framework designed to
support wrapping general commands in multiple types of interfaces,
including at the command line, HTML, and API levels.

dependent_to.name: py-metaphlan
dependent_to.description:
MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of
microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from
metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.

dependent_to.name: py-pipits
dependent_to.description: Automated pipeline for analyses of fungal ITS from the Illumina

dependent_to.name: py-picrust
dependent_to.description:
bioinformatics software package designed to predict metagenome
functional content from marker gene surveys and full genomes.

dependent_to.name: py-picrust2
dependent_to.description:
PICRUSt2 is a software for predicting functional abundances based only
on marker gene sequences.
